Revert only on the basis what was added was already mentioned without such POV comments as 'These vocalists are epitomes' and 'these vocalists suck'.
removed Celtic metal from the sub-genre list; the article was merged into Folk Metal
Revert to last version by Leyasu. Several POV insertions.
Revert back to last version by myself. A lot of POV insertions, so killing them all in one go.
/* '''do me hard and long! baby''' */ Revert. Obvious vandalism.
Removed Fsuion Genres whos articles explicitly state they are not fusions of Heavy Metal.
Removed Viking Metal. The article states that its a cross-genre refernece, not a subgenre.
Deleted Speed Metal. [[list of heavy metal genres]] specifically says its not a genre, and is a cross-genre reference.
Deleted Oriental Metal - supposed crossover of 'Death Metal and Doom Metal with Oriental influences' (Hello neoglism)
Deleted NSBM. Subgenre of Black Metal, not Heavy Metal.
Deleted Melodeath. According to its article its a subgenre of Death Metal, not Heavy Metal.
/* Heavy metal dance */ edited out superfluous text
"discordant"->"dissonant"; adding "add" because volume and dissonance are quite distinct
/* Origins (1960s and early 1970s) */ Missing a full stop
/* Controversy from ''within'' the genre */ Attempt at making things slightly more neutral - if you are to say True, a link to the [[True Metal]] article should be provided.

cleaned up reference to power metal in ===Themes===
/* Classic Heavy Metal (Late 1970s and early 1980s) */ style, albums in italics
The sentence after it provides the same information more fluently
/* Characteristics */ Revert, Vandalism - insertion of random name in the middle of a sentence.
/* Underground Metal (1980s, 1990s, and 2000s) */ Revert, POV. Slander against Black Metal bands. Glorification of one paticular band.
/* Underground Metal (1980s, 1990s, and 2000s) */ Removed more POV. Was a very flawed attempt at expanding the history.
/* Underground Metal (1980s, 1990s, and 2000s) */ Rmoved yet more POV. Nightwish and Dragonforce are Prodiguous?
/* Classical influence */ Revert, POV. Does elaborate the point that the whole artlce needs serious expansion.
Revert; a lot of the things altered are backed by sources.
Phish is not progressive rock and is less influenced by metal than 70+% of rock bands
Nu-metal is not metal (nor are Queens of the Stone Age or Tool, leaving only Pantera... 1/10)
Jimi Hendrix did not pioneer guitar virtuosity (Andres Sergovia, Albert King, Eric Clapton, etc.), although he was probably the biggest influence overall on the next generation of virtuosos
Led Zeppelin, Uriah Heep, Deep Purple and UFO are not metal bands; aqualung is not a metal song
Plenty of people have claimed to have made the first heavy metal album.
Distortion had been done far more seriously than Sgt. Pepper's well before it
You Really Got Me is light years away from metal.
You Really Got Me is light years away from metal.
Grand Funk Railroad is not a "proto-heavy metal" band or anything close to it
/* Underground Metal (1980s, 1990s, and 2000s) */ Revert. Way too much POV.
